title: In game ping has increased in game from ~27ms to constant 117ms since yesterday, ISP or Riot issue?
body:
http://imgur.com/a/Gi2Nv tracert to riot server

I live in Ontario, Canada, around an hour outside of Toronto.

I played a ranked game last night and noticed my in game ping was at a **constant 117ms**, whereas it usually sat at around 27ms. **Restarting client, computer, and router all had no effect.** Furthermore, **no other network traffic was affected.** Ping tests to various websites (google etc) resulted in their usual latency of 15-30ms. Although we ended up winning, I decided to avoid playing another game. Today I played an ARAM to see if the issue was resolved, but **my latency still remained at a constant 115ms+**

I ran a tracert (attached above) and was curious whether the increase in latency was due to an issue on Riot's end, or if it was an issue with my ISP (Nexicom). Also, is this issue likely to be resolved soon? It is very frustrating to play with an extra ~90ms of latency.

Thanks in advance!

-edit- fixed imgur link

replies.body: The exact same thing is happening to me as well, I also live about an hour away from Toronto, constant 90ms up from the usual 45ms for the past 3-4 days.

It doesn't look like there's been any issues with our servers, but there may some hiccups between your network and our game servers.   It looks like you pinged to the right server, but I recommend using [WinMTR ](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/)to traceroute instead.  It paints a better picture of what's going on, but be sure to run it for a few minutes.  Let me know what you find.
Thanks for the reply! I ran the test approximately 250 times, let me know if that's sufficient: http://pastebin.com/f9kFRw6L

Thanks for taking to time to let that traceroute process.  I can see two problems here, the last ping before reaching riot direct spikes a bit.  It may not be has impacting though as your router, which already starts off pretty high before ever leaving your home network.  You usually want your router to be like 0 or 1, but it's coming up as 51.  In this case, I suggest going over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to tune up your local network.  I hope that helps!

Thanks, unfortunately that doesn't help me with my issue too much. 

Where are you seeing the 51ms ping to my router? The only 51 I see is the "Worst" section of the first address, which isn't even the address of my router. The 51 was an uncommon spike (you can see the average is closer to 14) due to interference on my home wifi network- When I did that test, I did it on my laptop over my 2.4gHz wireless network far from my router. Usually I have a ping of 1-3ms but because of the location of my router it occasionally spikes due to interference. When I play LoL I'm in a different part of my house on a 5gHz connection and have a much more stable connection. If you'd like I could rerun the test from my 5gHz network, but I figured because the issue was clearly farther down the line it wouldn't make a difference.

The issue at hand is the fact that my in game ping has increased from 27ms to a STEADY 115ms, and I'm not sure what the cause of that was. I wanted to know if it was an issue on Riot's end (and if it was, bring your attention to it) or an issue with my ISP, or if there was any way of knowing if / when this would be resolved.

Any information you could provide me regarding a possible timeframe for this getting resolved or what is responsible for the increase would be appreciated.

(Here is the typical ping to my router over my 2.4gHz home network, again not sure where the 51ms is coming from: http://imgur.com/20a9Ztc )

Updating to say that the issue still isn't resolved, and I have since attempted using the Hextech Repair Tool with no effect. In addition, I have released / renewed IP and flushed DNS and still no result, I'm getting 115ms ping whereas I usually get 27ms, and ONLY to Riot's in game server.

Another bump / update as I still haven't had any of my questions answered, and my in game ping is still at a constant 115ms+

What is the cause of this and when will it be fixed?
